Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Jens Ålevik
Reviews.Content: i have the qx10 to my xperia S phone and it works really well (supporting the NFC function even when powered of)this bundle however i did order to my sister. she uses a iphone 5 and so far i have heard nothing bad about how it function, even when apple don't want to include NFC on thier products (iphones).told her she needed the "PlayMemories Mobile" app installed on her iphone and that she needed to connect to the camera (QX10) manually the first time hooking it up, after that you'll need to have wifi started on the iphone  and start the app. it should hook up with the QX10 with no problems. i guess if you use a iphone device it would get like 4 stars out of 5. but with its 18.2 MP and 10x optical zoom it really is a fine camera at a really good prize! the photot it will transfer to your phone is 2 MP but the fully 18.2 MP photo is stored on the microSD card. (also it does not have to be mounted on the phone to work, just as long as it is connected with the wifi, so tri pod stand comes in use here.)the NFC sensor on the camera is on the top of it, next to the power button, works really well with most android phones that supports NFC. (it's NOT a sony phones only device)sometimes it's not explain that well but this product comes without a battery charger, but you do get a USB cable so you can hook the QX10 up to a computer when the camera is powered off. then it will charge the battery. if you order the QX10 only (not bundle like this) you won't get a microSD card needed to take photos. a 64gb microSD card will be able to hold about 9700 photos so you will most likely not need a microSD over 16gb to the QX10.hope this help some of you.ps: also important to have some kind of case to store the QX10 cam in when not in use to avoid accidents (damage to the unit)sorry about some spelling errors... im not english speaking normally.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera take great pictures (vivid colors + good quality under low light conditions). The only problem I've seen so far is the small delay time for saving the pictures in the smartphone storage. Other than that, I consider it a great buy.
